data.title: Andrew Crowley
data.text:
London Studio Musician

Born in London, Andrew Crowley has established himself over the past 35 years as of one the most diverse, recorded and high profile trumpet players in the world. He has held positions, performed and recorded as a soloist with London orchestras, music institutions, West End chairs and just about everything else! For many years, much of his time is consumed as the manager/trumpeter with the internationally acclaimed London Brass.

He is well-known these days as a studio musician who can be heard on hundreds of film scores, from Gladiator to Harry Potter and numerous James Bond 007 movies. His solo film highlight credits include the award winning Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy, The Skin I Live In (composer Alberto Iglesias) and the Legend of Bagger Vance by Rachel Portman.

Other notable appearances within different genres of music have included jazz/pop artists such as Quincy Jones, Gregory Porter, Joni Mitchell, Sir Paul McCartney and Peter Gabriel.

In the world of education, Andrew has given master classes globally, from London to the Juilliard School of Music and has been the adjudicator for the BBC Young Musician and Young Brass Player finals. He has also just completed recording the London Trinity grade 1-8 syllabus repertoire, which will be available worldwide as audio downloads, together with the books and promotional videos.

Schilke performances have featured him playing his new X3 on 2018 soundtracks: Star Wars, Avengers, Mission Impossible, Hotel Transylvania, Robin Hood, Cherry Blue & Yuli. Plus, solo Cornet features (A2) on Mary Poppins Returns, The Ballad of Buster Scruggs and Flugelhorn on the Jungle Book inspired movie, Mowgli.
